bill_title: to allow first class municipalities to adopt an ordinance regulating the minimum driving age and hours a vehicle may be operated by a person who is at least fourteen years of age and less than sixteen years of age.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to allow first class municipalities to adopt an ordinance regulating the minimum driving age and hours a vehicle may operated by a person who is at least fourteen years of age and less than sixteen years of age. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. Any first class municipality for the area within the municipal boundaries may adopt, by ordinance, regulations concerning the minimum driving age for any person who is at least fourteen years of age and less than sixteen years of age. Any first class municipality may also adopt, by ordinance, regulations concerning the hours of the day a vehicle may be operated by any person who is at least fourteen years of age and less than sixteen years of age. If the municipality adopts an ordinance pursuant to this section, the regulations shall be more restrictive than the requirements enacted by the Legislature pursuant to chapter 32-12. 750 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.016 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to allow first class municipalities to adopt an ordinance regulating the minimum driving age and hours a vehicle may be operated by a person who is at least fourteen years of age and less than sixteen years of age. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. Any first class municipality for the area within the municipal boundaries may adopt, by ordinance, regulations concerning the minimum driving age for any person who is at least fourteen years of age and less than sixteen years of age. Any first class municipality may also adopt, by ordinance, regulations concerning the hours of the day a vehicle may be operated by any person who is at least fourteen years of age and less than sixteen years of age. If the municipality adopts an ordinance pursuant to this section, the regulations shall be more restrictive than the requirements enacted by the Legislature pursuant to chapter 32-12. BILL HISTORY 1/26/98 First read in House and referred to Local Government. H.J. 228 2/3/98 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/3/98 Referred to Transportation. H.J. 375 2/4/98 House of Representatives Re-referred to Transportation. H.J. 381 2/9/98 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/11/98 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/11/98 Transportation Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 7, NAYS 5.
